title: Authors and Citation
text: Addae-Mensah B, Tilley E, Clavijo Daza (2025). hydrogeologicalghana: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data Ghana. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hydrogeologicalghana: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana},   author = {Benedict Addae-Mensah and Elizabeth Tilley and Adriana {Clavijo Daza}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana
text: goal hydrogeologicalghana provide data boreholes collected study hydrogeological dynamics greater Accra Ashanti regions Ghana.

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana
text: can install development version hydrogeologicalghana GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana
text: package provides access measurements pumping tests systematically conducted boreholes assess crucial hydrogeological parameters, specifically focusing pumping rates drawdown.

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana
text: dataset hydrogeologicalghana contains data pumping tests systematically conducted boreholes assess crucial hydrogeological parameters, specifically focusing pumping rates drawdown greater Accra Ashanti regions Ghana. 12 observations 10 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana
code: library(hydrogeologicalghana) library(dplyr)  # Summary statistics by region region_summary <- hydrogeologicalghana |>   group_by(region) |>    summarise(     count = n(),     avg_depth = mean(depth, na.rm = TRUE),     max_pump_rate = max(pumping_rate, na.rm = TRUE),     min_water_level = min(static_water_level, na.rm = TRUE)   )  # Print the formatted table kable(region_summary,        caption = "Summary Statistics by Region",        align = "c",       col.names = c("Region",                     "Count",                     "Average depth",                     "Max. pump rate",                     "Min. water level")) library(hydrogeologicalghana) library(ggplot2)  # Scatter plot scatter_plot <- hydrogeologicalghana |>   ggplot(aes(x = depth, y = static_water_level, color = region)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Scatter plot of depth vs. water level by region",        x = "Depth (m)",        y = "Water Level (m)") +   theme_minimal()  # Display the scatter plot print(scatter_plot)

title: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana

R #>   package version 0.0.0.9000. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {hydrogeologicalghana: Hydrogeological Dynamics Data in Ghana}, #>     author = {Benedict Addae-Mensah and Elizabeth Tilley and Adriana {Clavijo Daza}}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, #>   }

title: hydrogeologicalghana: Hydrogeological dynamics in the greater Accra and Ashanti regions of Ghana — hydrogeologicalghana
hydrogeologicalghana: Hydrogeological dynamics in the greater Accra and Ashanti regions of Ghana — hydrogeologicalghana
text: tibble 12 rows 10 variables date Date measurement. region Name region borehole drilled. community Name community borehole drilled. depth Vertical distance surface ground bottom borehole, measured meters (m). depth borehole determines deep drilling process goes reach desired aquifer geological layer. static_water_level Llevel water borehole pumping taking place. measured ground surface water surface inside borehole. measurement crucial determining natural water table level initial conditions aquifer. pumping_rate Volume water extracted borehole per unit time, typically measured liters per minute (l/min). rate essential determining efficiency capacity borehole, well designing pump system. drawdown Difference static water level water level borehole pumping started. indicates much water level dropped due pumping measured meters (m). Drawdown helps understanding impact pumping aquifer essential calculating sustainable yield borehole. specific_capacity Measure productivity borehole, defined pumping rate per unit drawdown. expressed terms volume per unit time per unit drawdown, commonly m_/day per meter drawdown, can simplified m_/day. parameter helps assessing efficiency borehole aquifer's ability transmit water borehole. transmissivity Measure much water can transmitted horizontally aquifer material unit width measured cubic meters per day (m_/day). product hydraulic conductivity aquifer saturated thickness aquifer. High transmissivity indicates highly productive aquifer. aquifer_material Type geological materials (sand, gravel, limestone, sandstone) make aquifer borehole extracts water. characteristics materials, including porosity permeability, influence aquifer's ability store transmit water. Understanding aquifer material critical assessing water quality potential yield borehole.
